17  set_need_gradient_residual_term (0,true);
18

44 // =================================================================================
45 // residualRHS
46 // =================================================================================
47 // This function calculates the residual equations for each variable. It takes
48 // "variable_list" as an input, which is a list of the value and derivatives of
49 // each of the variables at a specific quadrature point. The (x,y,z) location of
50 // that quadrature point is given by "q_point_loc". The function outputs residuals
51 // to variable_list. The index for each variable in this list corresponds to
52 // the index given at the top of this file.
53 
54 template <int dim, int degree>
55 void customPDE<dim,degree>::residualRHS(variableContainer<dim,degree,dealii::VectorizedArray<double> > & variable_list,
56  dealii::Point<dim, dealii::VectorizedArray<double> > q_point_loc) const {
57 
58 // Concentration
59 scalarvalueType c = variable_list.get_scalar_value(0);
60 scalargradType cx = variable_list.get_scalar_gradient(0);
61 
62 // Order parameter
63 scalarvalueType n = variable_list.get_scalar_value(1);
64 scalargradType nx = variable_list.get_scalar_gradient(1);
65 
66 // Field for split formulation of the biharmonic term
67 scalargradType biharmx = variable_list.get_scalar_gradient(2);
68 
69 // Bulk terms
70 scalarvalueType faV = 0.5*c*c/16.0;
71 scalarvalueType facV = 0.5*c/8.0;
72 scalarvalueType faccV = constV(0.5/8.0);
73 scalarvalueType fbV = 0.5*(c-1.0)*(c-1.0)/16.0;
74 scalarvalueType fbcV = 0.5*(c-1.0)/8.0;
75 scalarvalueType fbccV = constV(0.5/8.0);
76 scalarvalueType hV = 3.0*n*n-2.0*n*n*n;
77 scalarvalueType hnV = 6.0*n-6.0*n*n;
78 
79 scalarvalueType normgradn = std::sqrt(nx.norm_square());
80 scalargradType normal = nx/(normgradn+constV(1.0e-16));
81 
82 scalarvalueType gamma;
83 scalargradType dgammadnormal;
84 // Anisotropy function calculates gamma and dgamma/dn
85 anisotropy(normal, gamma, dgammadnormal);
86 
87 // Product of projection matrix and dgammadnorm vector
88 scalargradType aniso;
89 for (unsigned int i=0; i<dim; ++i){
90  for (unsigned int j=0; j<dim; ++j){
91  aniso[i] += -normal[i]*normal[j]*dgammadnormal[j];
92  if (i==j) aniso[i] +=dgammadnormal[j];
93  }
94 }
95 // Anisotropic gradient term
96 aniso = gamma*(aniso*normgradn+gamma*nx);
97 
98 // Residual expressions
99 scalarvalueType rcV = c;
100 scalargradType rcxV = constV(-McV*userInputs.dtValue)*(cx*((1.0-hV)*faccV+hV*fbccV)+nx*hnV*(fbcV-facV));
101 scalarvalueType rnV = n-constV(userInputs.dtValue*MnV)*(fbV-faV)*hnV;
102 scalargradType rnxV = constV(userInputs.dtValue*MnV)*(-aniso+constV(delta2)*biharmx);
103 scalargradType rbiharmxV = -nx;
104 
105 // Submission of residuals
106 variable_list.set_scalar_value_residual_term(0,rcV);
107 variable_list.set_scalar_gradient_residual_term(0,rcxV);
108 
109 variable_list.set_scalar_value_residual_term(1,rnV);
110 variable_list.set_scalar_gradient_residual_term(1,rnxV);
111 
112 variable_list.set_scalar_gradient_residual_term(2,rbiharmxV);
113 }
114 
115 // =================================================================================
116 // residualLHS (needed only if at least one equation is elliptic)
117 // =================================================================================
118 // This function calculates the residual equations for the iterative solver for
119 // elliptic equations.for each variable. It takes "variable_list" as an input,
120 // which is a list of the value and derivatives of each of the variables at a
121 // specific quadrature point. The (x,y,z) location of that quadrature point is given
122 // by "q_point_loc". The function outputs residual terms to "variable_list"
123 // for the left-hand-side of the residual equation for the iterative solver. The
124 // index for each variable in this list corresponds to
125 // the index given at the top of this file. If there are multiple elliptic equations,
126 // conditional statements should be used to ensure that the correct residual is
127 // being submitted. The index of the field being solved can be accessed by
128 // "this->currentFieldIndex".
129 
130 template <int dim, int degree>
131 void customPDE<dim,degree>::residualLHS(variableContainer<dim,degree,dealii::VectorizedArray<double> > & variable_list,
132  dealii::Point<dim, dealii::VectorizedArray<double> > q_point_loc) const {
133 }
